improvement_suggestions: Relax the YARA rule by using wildcards (`?`) to account for potential variations in register values and immediate values.  Instead of requiring all patterns to match, consider using an "all of them" condition, requiring the patterns to be close to each other. Also, consider expanding the scope of the rule to include more context around the identified instruction sequences.

improvement_suggestions: Broaden the YARA rule by introducing wildcards (`?`) to allow for variations in the instruction sequences.  Instead of fixed skip offsets, consider a range or a more dynamic approach.  Alternatively, target a different, more stable instruction sequence that is less likely to be altered during evasion techniques.  It may also be beneficial to reduce the number of patterns used.
